Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of IAD decision on humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) section 28
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicants failed to meet residency requirements due to financial reasons and returning to Germany to sell their house
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: IAD found insufficient humanitarian and compassionate justification to retain permanent resident status
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Extended absence from Canada, failure to fulfill residency obligation
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Humanitarian and compassionate considerations including establishment in Canada and best interests of children
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Establishment in Canada, best interests of children, duration and reason for absence
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Financial circumstances, property sale in Germany, family ties in Canada
Crimes.Application_Basis: Humanitarian and compassionate grounds under IRPA
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Nature and purpose of absences, connections to Canada
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Retention of permanent resident status despite non-compliance
Crimes.Governing_Rule: IAD must assess whether H&C grounds justify exception to residency requirement
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient evidence of exceptional hardship or strong re-establishment in Canada
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Minimal impact on children if returned to Germany
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicants did not meet residency requirements and appealed based on humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: IAD considered all relevant factors but weighed them against residency obligations
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: No major disputes over authenticity or credibility
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Non-compliant: less than required 730 days in Canada within five years
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: IAD jurisdiction over appeals on permanent resident status
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Balanced and thorough evaluation by IAD
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Absences were voluntary and primarily for financial convenience; insufficient H&C justification

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Appeal of removal order based on residency non-compliance
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of IAD decision on humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) section 28
Crimes.Outcome: Judicial review dismissed; IAD decision upheld
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review of IAD decision regarding permanent resident status
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicants' claims not found to undermine decision
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Documentary and testimonial evidence regarding residence, finances, and family circumstances
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Humanitarian and compassionate grounds due to financial hardship and family life in Canada
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Best interests of children, degree of establishment in Canada, justification for absence
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Administrative appeal followed by judicial review
Crimes.Application_Error: Alleged failure to properly consider best interests of children
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Claimed by applicants, but court found IAD adequately considered child interests
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to mixed questions of fact and law
Crimes.Application_Factor: Duration and purpose of absences from Canada
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Removal order upheld due to failure to meet residency obligation
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether IAD reasonably assessed humanitarian and compassionate factors
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Insufficient fulfillment of residency obligation and inadequate humanitarian and compassionate justification
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Process found to be fair and in accordance with natural justice
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Not a central factor in the decision
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of IADâ€™s interpretation and weighing of H&C factors
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Focus: Canadian immigration law and administrative law principles
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Judicial review of administrative tribunal decision
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to accumulate required residency days
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Violation of residency obligation under IRPA
